newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka shares end weaker in lacklustre trading.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka shares end weaker in lacklustre trading.

text.p: Colombo stocks closed slightly lower on Wednesday after remaining in tight ranges, with buying orders for finance, plantation and selective manufacturing shares largely unfulfilled on lack of liquidity, brokers said.
The all share index fell 1.04 points to 558.66. Lanka Walltile fell two rupees to 25 and Bata one to 21.50.
Sri Lankan investors who have seen volatility in 13 years of ethnic strife in their country shrugged off the Iraq crisis, brokers said.
Turnover was 5.1 million rupees, with 260,645 shares changing hands.

Demand in Sampath Bank, John Keells Holdings, Hayleys, National Development Bank, Development Finance, Tea Smallholder Factories, Blue Diamonds and Dockyard did not turn into deals on lack of liquidity, brokers said.
"Volumes have dried up with sellers refusing to give shares at current prices," said Ralph Wijesinghe of Asia Securities.
